oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter of John Chamberlain to Sir Ralph Winwood
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chamberlain, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Theater--England--London--History--17th century
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John Chamberlain (1553-1628) was a professional letter-writer employed by contemporaries who preserved his letters in considerable numbers. One of his correspondents was Sir Ralph Winwood (1562 or 1563 - 1617), diplomat and secretary of state. This letter, dated 23 February 1612/13, describes the performance events staged for the wedding of Princess Elizabeth to Frederick, Elector Palatine.
